meanings.definition: The quality of being able to repel or drive away something.
meanings.sent1: The repellency of the bug spray kept the mosquitoes away from me.
meanings.sent2: The raincoat's repellency against water kept me dry during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The repellency of the scarecrow made the birds think it was a real person!
meanings.sent4: Her strong personality had a repellency that pushed people away.
meanings.sent5: The repellency of the magnet to the opposite pole was fascinating to watch.

meanings.definition: The ability to resist or prevent something from adhering to a surface.
meanings.sent1: The non-stick pan's repellency made cooking and cleaning much easier.
meanings.sent2: The repellency of the wax on the car prevented dirt from sticking to it.
meanings.sent3: The repellency of the glue was so strong that nothing could stick to it!
meanings.sent4: Her charm had a repellency that made it hard for anyone to get close to her.
meanings.sent5: The repellency of the oil on the water created a beautiful rainbow effect.

meanings.definition: The state of being unattractive or unappealing.
meanings.sent1: The repellency of the old, torn couch made it hard to sell.
meanings.sent2: The repellency of the bitter medicine made it difficult to swallow.
meanings.sent3: The repellency of the ugly sweater actually made it a hit at the party!
meanings.sent4: The repellency of the abandoned house kept potential buyers away.
meanings.sent5: The repellency of the spoiled food was evident from the awful smell.
